com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements

Class PageElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements.PageElement
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Button, Checkbox, Div, IFrame, Label, Link, PageSelectElement, Radiobutton, Span, Table, Textbox

    public class PageElement
extends Object
    Base element class that handles creation of element types and allows late binding. It takes a selector type, a selector value and a driver, and uses that to exercise Selenium WebDriver functionality. Classes that extend this are wrappers to allow clearer coding conventions. For example a Button element just allows the specific declaration of a button on a web page for functionality.

    Selenium already has a WebElement class, but using it requires you to be able to see the elements on the page as soon as you declare the page object. This doesn't work, since we want to define the page before run time. The solution to the problem is late binding, or declaring the objects as they are used. Every time we use an element on the page, we look for it at the time we are using it.

    Note: Renamed from WebElement to PageElement to avoid name space conflicts with selenium's WebElement object when Selenium's WebElement type was needed as a return type for the element() function.

    To Do:

    • Remove the need to pass in a driver class instance for the creation of every element and delay that binding to a singleton class that can be changed, allowing the use of multiple drivers through a testing session.
    • Look into creating a Selenium WebElement member variable to store the element after the first time it is used. This could increase the speed of calling objects that get called often.

      • PageElement

        public PageElement(SelectorType selectorType,
                   String selectorValue)
        The constructor for a WebElement to initialize how an element is going to be found when it is worked on by the WebDriver class. Takes a reference to the WebDriver class that will be exercising its functionality.
        Parameters:
        selectorType - SelectorType
        selectorValue - String

      • element

        protected org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element()
                                          throws ElementNotFoundException
        Returns the Selenium WebElement if it can be found on the current page. Provides late binding for elements so that the driver does not look for them until they are called, at which point the driver should be on the correct page.
        Returns:
        org.openqa.selenium.WebElement the Selenium WebElement object type that can be acted upon
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - if the element cannot be found

        Parameters:
        text - String (text to type)
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • pressKeys

        public PageElement pressKeys(String text)
                      throws AWTException,
                             ElementNotFoundException
        Press keys with focus on a PageElement. This is useful when type() or sendKeys isn't working due to a mask or hidden field being employed to grab key press events and operate on each one.
        Parameters:
        text - String (keys to type)
        Returns:
        PageElement (for chaining)
        Throws:
        AWTException - if the key cannot be pressed.
        ElementNotFoundException - if the element cannot be found

      • click

        public PageElement click()
                  throws ElementNotFoundException
        Click a PageElement.

        This function waits up to 10 seconds in 500 millisecond increments to see if the element is visible. This wait ensures that context-switching, such as bringing up a pop-up, AJAX calls, etc. will not fail a test.

        Aliases:

        • Checkbox.check()
        • Radiobutton.select()
        Returns:
        PageElement (for chaining)
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - if the element cannot be found

      • clear

        public PageElement clear()
                  throws ElementNotFoundException
        Clear a PageElement. Clears text in a text box. Un-checks check boxes. Clears radio button choices.

        Aliases:

        • Checkbox.uncheck()
        Returns:
        PageElement (for chaining)
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - if the element cannot be found

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
                  throws ElementNotFoundException
        Returns true if the element is enabled within 10 seconds; otherwise returns false.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the element is enabled within 10 seconds; otherwise returns false.
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - if the element cannot be found

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(int seconds)
                  throws ElementNotFoundException
        Returns true if the element is enabled within the number of seconds indicated; otherwise returns false.

        This function waits a number of seconds in 500 millisecond increments to see if the element is visible. This wait ensures that context-switching, such as bringing up a pop-up, AJAX calls, etc. will not fail a test.

        A StaleElementReferenceException can be thrown when testing a Bootstrap website that uses divs as popups. We resolve this by catching the exception and retrying it 5 times. If it still fails, we catch the exception and return a failure indicating the element wasn't found instead of throwing an exception.

        Parameters:
        seconds - int the number of seconds to wait before returning failure.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the element is enabled within the number of seconds indicated; otherwise returns false.
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - if the element cannot be found

      • isSelected

        public boolean isSelected()
                   throws ElementNotFoundException
        Validates whether or not the element is selected.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the element is selected, false if it is not
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - if the element cannot be found

      • isDisplayed

        public boolean isDisplayed()
                    throws ElementNotFoundException
        Returns true if the element is displayed within 10 seconds; otherwise returns false.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the element is displayed within 10 seconds; otherwise returns false.
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - if the element cannot be found

      • isDisplayed

        public boolean isDisplayed(int seconds)
                    throws ElementNotFoundException
        Returns true if the element is displayed within the number of seconds indicated; otherwise returns false.

        This function waits a number of seconds in 500 millisecond increments to see if the element is visible. This wait ensures that context-switching, such as bringing up a pop-up, AJAX calls, etc. will not fail a test.

        A StaleElementReferenceException can be thrown when testing a Boostrap website that uses divs as popups. We resolve this by catching the exception and retrying it 5 times. If it still fails, we catch the exception and return a failure indicating the element wasn't found instead of throwing an exception.

        Parameters:
        seconds - int the number of seconds to wait before returning failure.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the element is displayed within the number of seconds indicated; otherwise returns false.
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - if the element cannot be found

      • doesNotExist

        public boolean doesNotExist()
                     throws NoSuchSelectorException
        Determines with 250 milliseconds (1/4 of a second) if an element is not present. This should be used when you expect an element to not be present and do not want to slow down your tests waiting for the normal timeout time to expire.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the element cannot be found, false if it is found
        Throws:
        NoSuchSelectorException - if the selector type passed is invalid

      • getText

        public String getText()
               throws ElementNotFoundException
        Returns the text of the page element as a String.
        Returns:
        String The text value stored in the element.
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - if the element cannot be found

        Throws:

      • attributeEquals

        public boolean attributeEquals(String attribute,
                               String value)
                        throws ElementNotFoundException
        Returns true if the element as an attribute equal to the value passed; otherwise returns false.

        Examples:

        • Determine if an element has a style="display:none" attribute set.
        Parameters:
        attribute - String the attribute to look for
        value - String the value to which attribute should be set
        Returns:
        boolean true if the element as an attribute equal to the value passed; otherwise returns false
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - if the element cannot be found
